member.name: IXAudio2.AddRef
member.summary: Adds a reference to the XAudio2 object.

member.name: IXAudio2.CommitChanges
member.summary: Atomically applies a set of operations that are tagged with a given identifier.
member.param: Identifier of the set of operations to be applied. To commit all pending operations, pass XAUDIO2_COMMIT_ALL.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; returns an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2.CreateMasteringVoice
member.summary: Creates and configures a mastering voice.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.
TBD
Flags that specify the behavior of the mastering voice. This can be 0 or XAUDIO2_NO_VIRTUAL_AUDIO_CLIENT.

param.name: InputChannels
param.para: Number of channels the mastering voice expects in its input audio.InputChannels must be less than or equal to XAUDIO2_MAX_AUDIO_CHANNELS.
You can set InputChannels to XAUDIO2_DEFAULT_CHANNELS, which causes XAudio2 to try to detect the system speaker configuration setup.

param.name: InputSampleRate
param.para: Sample rate of the input audio data of the mastering voice. This rate must be a multiple of XAUDIO2_QUANTUM_DENOMINATOR.InputSampleRate must be between XAUDIO2_MIN_SAMPLE_RATE and XAUDIO2_MAX_SAMPLE_RATE.
You can set InputSampleRate to XAUDIO2_DEFAULT_SAMPLERATE, with the default being determined by the current platform.
Windows Vista and Windows 7 default to the setting specified in the Sound Control Panel. The default for this setting is 44100 (or 48000 if required by the driver).

member.param: The audio stream category to use for this mastering voice.
Pointer to an structure that describes an effect chain to use in the mastering voice, or NULL to use no effects.

Identifier of the device to receive the output audio. Specifying the default value of NULL causes XAudio2 to select the global default audio device. On Windows 10 or later, NULL will also opt-in to the WASAPI virtualized client unless XAUDIO2_NO_VIRTUAL_AUDIO_CLIENT is passed in Flags.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code. Returns ERROR_NOT_FOUND if no default audio device exists and NULL is passed in as the szDeviceId parameter.
See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2.CreateSourceVoice
member.summary: Creates and configures a source voice.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Pointer to a one of the structures in the table below. This structure contains the expected format for all audio buffers submitted to the source voice. XAudio2 supports PCM and ADPCM voice types.
Format tag Wave format structure Size (in bytes)
WAVE_FORMAT_PCM (0x0001)
PCMWAVEFORMAT
16
-or-
18
WAVE_FORMAT_IEEE_FLOAT (0x0003) [32-bit]
PCMWAVEFORMAT
18
WAVE_FORMAT_ADPCM (0x0002) [MS-ADPCM]
ADPCMWAVEFORMAT
50
WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE (0xFFFE)
WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE
40
XAudio2 supports the following PCM formats.
8-bit (unsigned) integer PCM
16-bit integer PCM (optimal format for XAudio2)
20-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
24-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
32-bit integer PCM
32-bit float PCM (preferred format after 16-bit integer)The number of channels in a source voice must be less than or equal to XAUDIO2_MAX_AUDIO_CHANNELS. The sample rate of a source voice must be between XAUDIO2_MIN_SAMPLE_RATE and XAUDIO2_MAX_SAMPLE_RATE.
Note PCM data formats such as PCMWAVEFORMAT and ADPCMWAVEFORMAT that require more information than provided by WAVEFORMATEX have a WAVEFORMATEX structure as the first member in their format structures. When you create a source voice with one of those formats, cast the format's structure as a WAVEFORMATEX structure and use it as the value for pSourceFormat.
TBD

param.name: Flags
param.para: Flags that specify the behavior of the source voice. A flag can be 0 or a combination of one or more of the following:

listheader.description: No pitch control is available on the voice.

No sample rate conversion is available on the voice. The voice's outputs must have the same sample rate.
Note The XAUDIO2_VOICE_NOSRC flag causes the voice to behave as though the XAUDIO2_VOICE_NOPITCH flag also is specified.
The filter effect should be available on this voice.

param.div: Note The XAUDIO2_VOICE_MUSIC flag is not supported on Windows.

param.name: MaxFrequencyRatio
param.para: Highest allowable frequency ratio that can be set on this voice. The value for this argument must be between XAUDIO2_MIN_FREQ_RATIO and XAUDIO2_MAX_FREQ_RATIO. Subsequent calls to are clamped between XAUDIO2_MIN_FREQ_RATIO and MaxFrequencyRatio. The maximum value for this argument is defined as XAUDIO2_MAX_FREQ_RATIO, which allows pitch to be raised by up to 10 octaves.
If MaxFrequencyRatio is less than 1.0, the voice will use that ratio immediately after being created (rather than the default of 1.0).

listheader.description: For XMA voices, there is one more restriction on the MaxFrequencyRatio argument and the voice's sample rate. The product of these two numbers cannot exceed XAUDIO2_MAX_RATIO_TIMES_RATE_XMA_MONO for one-channel voices or XAUDIO2_MAX_RATIO_TIMES_RATE_XMA_MULTICHANNEL for voices with any other number of channels. If the value specified for MaxFrequencyRatio is too high for the specified format, the call to CreateSourceVoice fails and produces a debug message.

param.div: Note You can use the lowest possible MaxFrequencyRatio value to reduce XAudio2's memory usage.

member.param: Pointer to a client-provided callback interface, .
Pointer to a list of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the source voice.
Pointer to a list of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the source voice. If pSendList is NULL, the send list defaults to a single output to the first mastering voice created.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code.
See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2-specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2.CreateSubmixVoice
member.summary: Creates and configures a submix voice.
member.param: On success, returns a pointer to the new object.
Number of channels in the input audio data of the submix voice.InputChannels must be less than or equal to XAUDIO2_MAX_AUDIO_CHANNELS.
Sample rate of the input audio data of submix voice. This rate must be a multiple of XAUDIO2_QUANTUM_DENOMINATOR. InputSampleRate must be between XAUDIO2_MIN_SAMPLE_RATE and XAUDIO2_MAX_SAMPLE_RATE.
TBD

param.name: Flags
param.para: Flags that specify the behavior of the submix voice. It can be 0 or the following:

listheader.description: The filter effect should be available on this voice.

member.param: An arbitrary number that specifies when this voice is processed with respect to other submix voices, if the XAudio2 engine is running other submix voices. The voice is processed after all other voices that include a smaller ProcessingStage value and before all other voices that include a larger ProcessingStage value. Voices that include the same ProcessingStage value are processed in any order. A submix voice cannot send to another submix voice with a lower or equal ProcessingStage value. This prevents audio being lost due to a submix cycle.
Pointer to a list of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the submix voice.

Pointer to a list of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the submix voice. If pSendList is NULL, the send list will default to a single output to the first mastering voice created.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code.
See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2.GetPerformanceData
member.summary: Returns current resource usage details, such as available memory or CPU usage.
member.param: On success, pointer to an structure that is returned.

member.name: IXAudio2.QueryInterface
member.summary: Queries for a given COM interface on the XAudio2 object.
member.param: The REFIID that identifies the interface to query for.
Address of a pointer that receives the interface.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2.RegisterForCallbacks
member.summary: Adds an pointer to the engine callback list.
member.param: pointer to add to the engine callback list.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2.Release
member.summary: Releases a reference to the XAudio2 object.

member.name: IXAudio2.SetDebugConfiguration
member.summary: Changes global debug logging options for XAudio2.
member.param: Pointer to a structure that contains the new debug configuration.
This parameter is reserved and must be NULL.

member.name: IXAudio2.StartEngine
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2.UnregisterForCallbacks
member.summary: Removes an pointer from the engine callback list.
member.param: pointer to remove from the engine callback list. If the given pointer is present more than once in the list, only the first instance in the list will be removed.

summary.para: IXAudio2 is the interface for the XAudio2 object that manages all audio engine states, the audio processing thread, the voice graph, and so forth.

This is the only XAudio2 interface that is derived from the COM IUnknown interface. It controls the lifetime of the XAudio2 object using two methods derived from IUnknown: and . No other XAudio2 objects are reference-counted; their lifetimes are explicitly controlled using create and destroy calls, and are bounded by the lifetime of the XAudio2 object that owns them.
